						MONDAY 23 APRIL 22:30 BST - BBC TWO


						FROM GAVIN ESLER
					
					Hello,



						Today's Quote for the Day comes from this morning's speech from David Cameron on what he claimed is the increasingly yobbish and unpleasant nature of British society. 


"All these are sad signs of a culture that is becoming decivilised - and the terrible thing is, we're getting used to it."


In tonight's programme: 


YELTSIN


When he was in power his colourful attitude to life led to regular predictions of demise from heart failure. 


Today some seven years after his resignation from office, we finally received news of the death of the former Russian leader Boris Yeltsin - a transitional figure, some might say, between Gorbachev's reforms and the new authoritarianism of Putin. But what really is his legacy? 


CHALLENGER TANKS 


Mark Urban joins us from Baghdad, where the MoD has confirmed that insurgents have succeeded in penetrating the hide of a Challenger tank with a roadside bomb. 


What does this now mean for the safety of British troops? 


SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY 


On the day David Cameron makes a keynote speech about the need of government to balance rights with responsibilities, school teacher Angela Mason faces a lifetime ban from teaching from the General Teaching Council, the teacher's equivalent of being 'struck off.'


Her crime? She secretly filmed the bad behaviour routinely encountered in a school for a TV documentary. We'll be speaking to her live.


FRANCE 


Speaking of what government is for, this is clearly a watershed election for the French Republic and - by extension - for all of Europe. Now we know it is Sego vs Sarko in the final round - what difference will it make?


WiFi


Some people seem to be super-sensitive to low level microwave radiation. 


So on the day the City of London switches on the Europe's single largest wireless Internet zone, we meet the people who, unless they want to spend their lives wracked with migraines and nausea, will have to walk around with tin foil wrapped around their heads in this brave new world. 


AND FINALLY ...


Today's Joke Fit For an Eleven Year Old comes from (occasional) Newsnight viewer James (aged 13):


"Why is Arsenal FC like a three pin plug? Because they're both useless in Europe."


Newsnight is at 10.30pm on BBC2.


Gavin
